subject: proportion of large letters to small letters
msgSnippet: Hi group, I m trying to determine how much larger the tall and deep letters are than the small letters. It seems that the Read manual makes the large letters
messageBody:
Hi group,

I'm trying to determine how much larger the tall and deep letters are
than the small letters. It seems that the Read manual makes the large
letters double that of the smaller ones, but I'm not sure. To test
this out, I make two large representations of the letters, one in
which the large letters are about 1 1/2 times larger than the small
ones, and one in which the large ones are a full double size.

I'd appreciate as much feedback as possible to these two questions:

1. Which proportion looks the best in an ideal situation--where you
didn't have to worry about space, for example when you are doing art
work on a wall or doing calligraphy.

2. Which proportion looks better in writing? Let's pretend that you
have a nice large sheet in front of you and you know that you are
going to have to have a lot of line space for the larger letters, but
tighter space for the smaller ones.

Thanks!

Paul
